medical_history.chief_complaint: Hyperprolactinemia leading to osteopenia in a patient on long-term antipsychotic treatment.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Ms. A, a 58-year-old woman, had been on trifluoperazine for 2 years and haloperidol decanoate for the past 12 years. After starting haloperidol depot, she experienced amenorrhea for 18 months. Her periods became regular until menopause, which occurred 7 years before consultation. A systematic medication review indicated a mildly elevated prolactin level and subsequent evaluation revealed t scores indicating osteopenia.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Paranoid schizophrenia, amenorrhea, hyperprolactinemia, and osteopenia.
medical_history.social_history: Uniparous, non-smoker, performed 140 minutes of weight-bearing exercise per week, diet included 500 mg/day of calcium. No history of drug use or alcohol consumption mentioned.
